entry.title: Fork withholding attack
entry.summary:
The term "Proof of Partial Work" appears to be a novel concept within the realm of cryptocurrency, particularly in the context of Bitcoin mining. Despite its mention, there seems to be a scarcity of readily available information or detailed references on this subject outside of the specific post mentioned. This lack of information suggests that the concept might be relatively new or not widely discussed within the community.
Furthermore, for those interested in delving deeper into Bitcoin mining and possibly uncovering more about "Proof of Partial Work" or sharing insights, the establishment of a new [bitcoin mining mailing list](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoinminingdev?pli=1) has been highlighted. This platform could serve as a valuable resource for discussions, exchange of ideas, and dissemination of knowledge among developers, miners, and enthusiasts engaged in the Bitcoin mining sector. The creation of such a mailing list indicates an effort to foster a collaborative environment where individuals can stay informed about the latest developments, challenges, and innovations in Bitcoin mining.
